oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The American cow vet: How veterinarians can add value to ag operations and communities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hake, Marissa
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The role of a bovine veterinarian continues to change and differentiate, as the structure of the traditional farm evolves. Our cow vets will adapt into new roles on these farms and within our communities. Veterinarians have long been trusted sources of non-biased information for consumers and community members alike. As consumers, customers, and brands look for greater transparency from their supply chains, veterinarians can help facilitate meaningful communication and value-added services.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 304-305
